intro: Tithymalus brachypus, commonly known as the short-stemmed tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in early summer. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves that are aromatic and often used in traditional herbal medicine. Native to regions of Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, shady environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and herbalist practices.
